tweets.text: I am speaking today at the @BENetworking flood conference, very relevant as Storm Christoph brings potential heavy rain and flood risk #floodaware #floodrisk #Cumbria #weather @CumbriaCC @EnvAgency #StormChristoph https://t.co/F5kx1h4tBz

Water and sewerage companies will be able to reduce the frequency with which they monitor the sewage they discharge into water bodies, after the @EnvAgency relaxed its permitting requirements because of Covid-19.
https://t.co/h6FY3IvjtM

Click here for the latest advice and guidance https://t.co/2R3SELZUZe #Leeds #StormChristoph 

@leedsemergency @WYRForum @EnvAgencyYNE @WestYorkshireCA
@NadeschaZ @FinlayPringle @JNCC_UK @WWF @EnvAgency are you also at the conference? will search for you later / tomorrow on airmeet if i can figure it out :)

Good to see new dredging of the River Parrett underway between Northmoor & M5. Thanks @IDBsomerset for the pic below & for organising this water injection dredging with @TeamVanOord. Thanks also @EnvAgencySW @NESouthWest. The river level's stayed up well & forecast rain will help https://t.co/vGQTqDyHkE

tweets.text: Heavy rain may lead to localised surface water & river #flooding across parts of northern England today. Teams out on the ground operating tidal gates & putting up temporary flood barriers, including in #York. Check your local #flood risk here https://t.co/OkRQsKNblD #FloodRisk https://t.co/iWjYqWBJtm

tweets.text:
We have #floodalerts and #floodwarnings in place across the North West. 

Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/fiXvaBOMbi

An old video but explains the important work ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyNW‚Å© teams are out there doing across the north west to keep communities safe during #stormchristof #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/fn5kYHxi0e

There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

tweets.text:
#TeamEA have been in #Billington today ahead of #StormChristoph deploying temporary #flood barriers to better protect the community from flooding. 

Do you know your flood risk? Sign up for warnings here https://t.co/F1wbUHPZe8

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/wVMVE1n0B6

My latest blog. Again, a trisense between poetry, science & ecophilosophy, ending in a call to action. #Fluminism #Resistance 

I watched foxes yesterday, but I've seen them before. Thoughts are always swirling away, with drafts on the hard drive. Time to publish. https://t.co/o1aAkxxZQQ
Be prepared for flooding. Make sure you sign up for free flood warnings from https://t.co/nvMF75JN9W #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/oltghErLlB

With persistent heavy rainfall across the #Midlands today make sure you stay #floodaware 

‚ö†Ô∏èCheck your #flood risk: https://t.co/8HEpx2nkWv
‚ö†Ô∏èSign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr 
‚ö†Ô∏è Call Floodline: 0345 988 1188

REMEMBER:‚ö†Ô∏è Never walk or drive through flood water! https://t.co/JoGOGP6DzU

tweets.text:
Flood alerts have been sounded ‚Äì keep up to date with weather forecasts @MetOffice and advice from the @EnvAgency

Take regular medicines? Keep them close at hand in case you have to leave quickly See @PHE_uk advice here https://t.co/uYa7NYyyp6 #flooding

In preparation for potential #flooding due to #StormChristoph, #TeamEA are out across the @EnvAgencyMids area checking flood gates and removing silt to ensure they operate and seal effectively should we need to close them. https://t.co/bvAOmtqlbm

Our teams are out & about the #Midlands clearing blockages like here at Thorpe Astley #Leicestershire in advance of forecasted heavy rain. Please keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/v2EnVHrvng
üìΩÔ∏è As #StormChristoph moves in we've been speaking to  @stewart_mounsey from the @EnvAgency about what it means for the North West üëá@thefloodhub #HeartNews https://t.co/CAjUxPQzxC

Whilst it's important to sign up for @EnvAgency #FloodWarnings for river #flooding, it's important to know that even when there are no warnings issued in your local area, you could still be at risk from other sources of flooding, like surface water flooding #StormChristoph 
üè°üå¶Ô∏è https://t.co/lwpXIqQ1x0 https://t.co/uKFUaniZIR

tweets.text:
Back after a speedy lunch to a session on #coastal adaptation and #ClimateEmergency - first up, Catherine Wright from @EnvAgency, who is highlighting issues around #community adaptation, #resilience, perceptions of protection and the myths associated with that
#coastalfutures21 https://t.co/9Bl5o6lgYc

Session 2 is taking place right now for the @BENetworking  Flood Risk & Defence Development Conference with @JamesTraff_37 chairing @EnvAgency #FloodPrevention #FloodRisk #tidalflooding #infrastructure #FloodProtection @Waterman_group https://t.co/qHJjCekTBX

Not looking good. Field drain in upper catchment (at 300m aod) @NidderdaleAONB normally a trickle, gushing with just a few hours of rain. Multiply this many times & concerning to see developing into a large volume of water downstream @EnvAgencyYNE @CalverleyShins @OliverHarmarEA https://t.co/q1t1dTLvIJ

Is looking like a really tough few days ahead with a stark #forecast of ‚ÄúSignificant inland #flooding impacts are probable from Tues to Thurs for parts of N, C & E England.‚Äù @EnvAgencyNW prep continues across #Lancashire #Cumbria & beyond. #Floodaware https://t.co/IrsyPsUPgC
@Supergios @EnvAgency @MailOnline Thank you, where on the river did you film it please?
